KQF_B7EMRLJbxKa1T-Wp4A.text: City Restaurant holds a fond place in my heart -- the best sit-in chippy I've found in Edinburgh with a great selection of... everything you could want from a greasy spoon, really! The breakfasts are HUGE and great value for money -- you can change the selection and swap your haggis for mushrooms if you can't handle it first thing in the morning, or whatever -- there's also a veggie option. Then there's the usual "+chips" options with everything from fish to haggis to deep fried pizza. However, you can also get more 'normal' stuff like a HUGE plate of pasta, a healthy baked potato with a big choice of fillings, a salad or a filled roll. The atmosphere is quite nice though very informal -- great for people watching as you really get all sorts in there. Best thing about it is the service though -- the place is INCREDIBLY busy but the lovely waitresses (who are mostly Polish but all with very good English and always a big smile) are always happy to help and very friendly -- service is amazingly quick too. Good prices, and they stay open late. Love it!

2uiIzoqbIj2IlF75GbJlGg.text: The City Cafe is a wonderful cross over between a proper restaurant and a take away cafe greasy spoon thing - its really rather good.  The food isnt anything special, whether you sit in to enjoy what you have ordered, or take it out. However, the food is tasty, and the portions are huge - the price isnt bad either. The restaurant itself looks a bit 80's - but really, thats not a huge concern unless you were expecting 5 star kinda stuff. Staff seem to be friendly, even late at night when the restaurants main custom is drunken students, but during the day they are always nice.  This place is great if al;l you want is a hearty meal at a cheap price.

photos.caption: Photo of City Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

4rqDiNtXrpGpjEz9aJ0m_A.text: Look  *shifty eyes*   I'll be the first one to admit that this is not a healthy place to be in ..... but it makes my stomach so happy!  Their quarterpounder with cheese has saved my -academic- life several times, and I'm never disappointed by the quality of the meat either. It's perfect for that weekend grease run I always find myself doing.  How do I know the food is good in this particular greasy spoon? Well, I've got a very, very sensitive stomach, and if anything was awry, believe me, I would've known by now.  The only thing I've got to grumble about (I'm always grumbling about something aren't I?) is the mayonnaise, it's too vinegary. I don't really like it that much. But hey, I'm Dutch and we like our mayo, (no doubt about that). If you like your chips like you like your spoons (that is greasssy) this here'll do for you!  P.s. No whining about health now, I left my arteries at home, they don't have to know about this.

_xmr6SLKd9iyiBNJTj0Xzg.text: This place filled a much needed hole in my fringe timetable recently where we needed warm food and fast! Sitting down was a bonus.  Stumbled upon this place which at first looked like a chippy posing as a restaurant but I soon learned it was more the other way around.  Excellent table service, warm inviting interior, licensed, with a thoroughly broad menu for what I thought to be a chippy. Pasta dishes, grill, epic all day breakfasts and of course battered fish to name just a few highlights.  I went for my usual fish and chips which was gorgeous, crispy batter with flaky haddock and no sign of grease. Slightly overpriced but I all things considered I won't argue. My missus went for a pasta dish which she couldn't finish which is a first. Happy faces all round.  Busy wee place, especially the takeaway.   Good vibes from here, would like to go back when I'm not in a hurry and maybe sit upstairs out the way of the queues of folk getting takeaway and the stares from street prowlers glaring in the window!

SbQl187LbYXTzBDa1urdlg.text: This is a decent sort of fish and chips cafe next to the theatre.  The view of the Edinburgh street life is quite beautiful.  Unfortunately this place suffers from being a bit overpriced for such standard fair.  Still, not a bad place.

KFVN9BWjgAvpptX_L00wnA.text: While Benecol is clinically proven to lower your cholesterol, this place is clinically proven to raise it. I guarantee you'll enjoy eating at this place, but make sure you've sent off to China for your donor heart before hand, cuz you'll be needing a new one.  On my one and only visit I got a deep fried pizza which I chewed on in the company of two JF's. They, being PHD students, probably viewed me with utter contempt, and were only there with me to conduct a study into socially inept and underdeveloped human beings. As a result I ate with a reasonable degree of dignity in an effort not to draw too much attention to myself. Had I been dining alone, my behaviour would have been distinctly less muted, and I would have wrung the doughy treat out into my mouth like a tea towel saturated with pizza flavoured fat. Then with more enthusiasm than a Romanian prostitute who had just realised she could earn a Leu and get something warm in her belly at the same time, I would have sucked the oily dregs from its limp remains, and given thanks for the privilege.  YUM-YUM.

r2usUqyooXnnQFMdTO2Fkg.text: They don't make 'em like this anymore, and it's a shame.  A greasy spoon / chippy / cafeteria hybrid, City Restaurant is not about atmospheric fine dining, but without even trying manages to have a hundred times more character than the vast majority of Edinburgh's more illustrious eateries.  Students, office workers, tourists and dossers. You'll find them all in here, damaging their health via the basic yet tasty grub. A window seat is tremendous for a bit of people watching, and it's the kind of place you won't feel like a weirdo sitting on your own. Just bring a paper.

rXClNFSRx5pKRWpSpTcXSw.text: This place has a great range of customers from all walks of life who are loyal to City Restaurant, and I am myself one of them. It has a great menu and there is always something on the menu that you are sure to like no matter how fussy an eater you.  The best thing about City Restaurant, is that they always serve you very generous portions, which sometimes I struggle to actually finish, and I normally can put my food away.  It's a multi purpose restaurant, in that no matter what time of the day you go there, there is something on offer, in the morning they do a breakfast, for lunch there are baked potatoes and in the evening, fish and chips. Not that I would recommend this diet, but the fact that it's always an option is great.

qvnffMudaysqJxET1UsguA.text: This is a decent chip shop with a pretty good sit-in menu. My complaint is that my server seemed to have very little interest in providing a high quality service experience. Her attitude was very grumpy and uninterested. Maybe she was having a bad day but I certainly didn't leave a tip.

sCN3xFxkXMIh6UrQAJyKaw.text: Pizza, fish and chips, burgers...all available from this reliable cafe that is unashamedly on the greasy side of cheap dining.  The breakfast are a good filler and the afore mentioned offerings are all a-ok for a last option meal.   Late opening times and a city 'diner' atmosphere mean that City Restaurant has a certain charm that the locals seem to pick up on.

photos.caption: Photo of City Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

Vmg2c3hgQluxbNqzY098aQ.text: City Restaurant reminds me of the days of hanging out with my ex boyfriend and his friends, when he turned out to be a right idiot, this diner seems to remind me of the good times.   Basically being a chippy cross bred with a greasy spoon you can hear your heart sobbing to your lung (whhyy whyy is she doing this tooo meeee?!)  Absolutely fantastic for breakfast, it's one of the best in terms of sheer size. It's almost worth feeling really rough for.

o_HOz-gd3mp8EVQ0Np4U6Q.text: This cafe is cheap and is more like a Scottish diner. The ladies serving are friendly enough but don't expect too much from the food. It's basically what the Brits call a "chippie" stuff that tastes ok after a night out drinking with lots of sauces and vinegar. There is plenty of seating area inside but they aren't open very late. Their huge cooked breakfasts are probably like a better option, but only when you crave grease and carbs after  a wild night out.

photos.caption: Photo of City Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

PuvbosOON8IMqJgKhckToA.text: Modern fish and chips shop. Fish is great but chips is not as good as McDonalds. Service is good.

ZFJfuRY6EaKse-JDWtOESw.text: We all went in here for a dinner, after the steamie in the festival theatre in edinburgh, i can safely safe the food was very enjoyable, only one down side for me , if you are put up the stairs, then ask for them to reheat the food as not hot enough to eat imho by the time you get it too the table , or book in advance and ask for a table downstairs thanks for reading my review appreciated. here is other reviews on google about this place thanks for reading my review appreciated. maps.google.co.uk/maps/p...... (maps.google.co.uk/maps/p...) =UTF-8&q=city+restaurant+edinburgh&fb=1&gl=uk&hq=city+restaurant&hnear=04887b800a5982623:064f2147b7ce71727,Edinburgh,+Midlothian&cid=8663837595775637397&ei=RjSLT-TVNoKs8QP346DxCQ&sa=X&oi=local_result&ct=placepage-link&resnum=1&ved=0CFYQ4gkwAA copy and paste this whole link thanks

C3PBzr8PkTBs2_jEbatp-w.text: Went to this old favourite before the Theatre at my nieces suggestion. What a choice on offer. Not the best Scampi & chips I've ever had but tasty & served in a polite manner by a very busy waitress. Handy if you're up that way.

OA0xyq6jTL9UgtkSMOc53A.text: Eating here reminds me of eating at The Lumberjack Restaurant in Niagara Falls, where they serve the famous Lumberjack Breakfast: eight of everything. That'll be eight eggs, eight sausages, eight rashers of bacon, eight pancakesyou get the idea. Like its Canadian counterpart, the City offers meals of remarkable size and quantity. It's possible to have what would normally be considered a week's worth of fatty food served to you on a large, oval plate, all for about seven quid. It's unpretentious, down to earth, and gives great value of money, if your body can take the beating.

Ik4MlFLFg8wyXd7IiXtY2g.text: I'm not sure if this place is pushing it by calling itself a 'restaurant', as it is essentially a large chip shop with lots of tables and chairs. Saying this, I am not actually trying to be-little it - as City Restaurant is dear to many Edinburgh hearts. It is where you go to eat 'comfort food'. It is friendly, homely, cosy. and there chippy fare is really reather good. What's more they are trying to mix it up a little by offering a few newer and different menu options. Sometimes somewhere like this is just exactly what you need to feel warm and human.

tlJRQmBw1aWIOwmVgAFQWQ.text: City Restaurant is really just a glorified chippy, not that theres anything wrong with that. It's pretty cheap and they'll accommodate any requests if possible, I've asked for chips n gravy before just to prove this point to a friend, and of course they happily provided me with just that. Im also told by my flatmate that the signature 'city' burger is like eating a fist of beef! There is nothing really special about this place but it is just a cosy little place to go for some comfort food, mac n cheese, lasagne. ooooor you can have the 'chippy' dished up on a plate with a fork and knife instead of it being handed to you in a brown paper bag!

RCy40Fr3y5G62DK9d34PYg.text: I went here every few weeks growing up with my dad, but hadn't been for years until I took my boyfriend there last month. It was soo busy, but well controlled. My big breakfast was cheap, and included a cup of tea or coffee! It was very very tasty, a bit greasy but it hit the spot! If I lived closer to here, it would be a regular Sunday breakfast spot for me! When paying and leaving, it was hassle-free and a kind goodbye.

VHWAMFYY6wZ_whZS_uBcEQ.text: I haven't actually sat in this place yet but I can tell you that they do some very very good chips and I plan another visit there soon.

Rp7sKx0aMBUWE_fkaxFSig.text: This is a useful restaurant situated near the Festival Theatre and in walking distance of the university and fringe festival venues. I went there with a few friends and it's got decent chipshop type food at great prices. There are US-style booths to sit at. It also doubles up as a takeaway shop. So if you are wanting to eat in, you would be better sitting further away from the food. Where we sat there was always (often drunk) people coming in buying chips to take away. This didn't help us think we were in a restaurant and help with the atmosphere. Food was okay though, and it's position next to theatre/bars/uni means it can come in handy!

E2TPK1Wb4zC2wXOs16-tSA.text: Been here many times before, suits all ages . Good menu and lovely staff . Definitely one to visit !!

0R-ehyEEaXbKGmSuIbksPw.text: A mixed review. The food was great. Chips, gravy and fish cakes. I think the fish cakes had cheese in too which melted in the middle. Yum. A little over friend but tasty.   The chips and gravy.... Well you can't go wrong.   There's a bit of issue around the door between people need a seat the takeaway queue. My real issue is 3 hours later I was bed bound feeling like i wanted to vom my guts up. Was this city restaurant? I can't be 100%, the only thing I ate different was the fish cakes... I didn't throw up and after a couple hours laid down and sipping some camomile tea I was right as rain.   Just a speculation.

PHofIsFIXVfI6gziMTMegQ.text: The big red front and bright lights make City hard to miss! Although it smacked of the type of place that could shovel cheap food out to unwitting tourists, I have to say that it is NOT that kind of place. Yes, it does have a take-away counter and food under heat lamps, but it also has made-to-order food with table service.   I was bowled over with the Scottish Pie (Mince) and overly generous portion of chips! I saw several diners ordering breakfast in the evening, so they must be known for providing filling meals at a reasonable price.

6UiWaqPW6Dhto4qc4IUrCg.text: it is so big that i eat one meal in two times. Haddock is a bit tasteless. the chips is very good. It is a good place to bring friends to eat British food.

photos.caption: Photo of City Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. bread hadduck

JOCj6BvOJU6CZGq3yQJGDQ.text: A classy chippy... Fish of the day is a must... Upstairs for best views.

czmildRK_bL9gG6AeRq3JQ.text: A decent fast food place. I ordered fish and chips (battered) but they serve other types of food as well. It tasted fine, most things taste fine after they've been fried. Giving this a 4 star mainly because the waitress was so sweet. She made sure we were never low on water. She gave us all take out boxes and packed extra tartar sauce in small containers for each of us. Didn't expect such good service at a fast food place.

q5RrJgSMW4TE9TVcQCrdeg.text: We've eaten here for dinner a few times since coming to Edinburgh, so I can only really comment on it as a restaurant rather than as a chippy.  City's diner aesthetic gives it a bit of character compared to the other restaurants in the vicinity, with it's bold colour scheme. We decided to give it a shot on this first impression as it stood out from the drab buildings that occupy most of that street. At first we grabbed a corner table, but the seats near the window do allow for a great deal of people watching if that takes your fancy. We also found the staff there pretty friendly and chatty, which also made for a nice relaxed atmosphere.  Each time we've visited we've had a good meal, their chip shop chips are great and more flavourful than the regular chips you might get from another restaurant, which was a nice change. Each time we've been we've tried different meals and combinations and never been disappointed.   Price-wise it's about average, getting a bit pricey if you really want a steak, though you can have a good meal from 10-20 with drinks, which is decent value. I'd also recommend their cake of the moment as it's a bit cheaper and they normally have really nice cakes on offer.

L4XieytSMAy_vkJ75OfjVQ.text: Are you positively knackered after a day of rollicking frolicking? Do you happen to be in Edinburgh on or around the sumptuous premises of 33-35 Nicolson Street EH8 9BE? If yes and yes, and arguably if no and yes (but not if yes and no or if no and no), may I gently nudge you toward my favorite cubular foodstuffs joint, Le City Restaurant, whose unparalleled cube-iness is a geometry fetishizer's daydream. Pop in for cylindrical cakes, rhomboid sands., and triangular zas. It's food to get you in shape. EDIT: the sentence you just read is True only in the sense that some of the food in geometric, not in the sense that you'll look good in the mirror.

STNOIEKEM7bDlQ34VveAvw.text: City Restaurant is a decent chip shop with a side line in all day breakfasts and grills. There is plenty of seating (there is more seating upstairs) and the staff are friendly enough. So if you fancy a breakfast or chips and want to escape the cold City Restaurant is fairly pleasant.  Why 3 stars, well the issue I have is that it is a bit more expensive than the other chip shops nearby, but the food is of no better quality, heck most of it tastes the same because it is likely from the same supplier...   The quarter pounder, mince pie, sausage etc are identical to those found in Central Takeaway, I bring this up because at lunch time Central do a takeaway offer which means a selection of dishes only cost a couple of pounds (and in my opinion they do better chips).  In short City Restaurant is fine-to-good if you want somewhere to sit and chat while getting your fried food fix, otherwise there are better options.

F-10JpfuuJS7tMRFd6IXjQ.text: The city restaurant sends me back to childhood days spent walking along the marine parade in  Lyme Regis, eating chips, trying to avoid heat stroke. Sure, there is no sea right outside the restaurant, but the chips are chunky and flavoursome (for potatoes).   Portions come in small or large, the former costing 1.60, the latter 2.20. I go or the small portion which is rather generous. There are off times, and it seems as though the chips are at their best around 12 and 5. Extras include curry, mushy peas and cheese. On ordering, you can ask for brown sauce, salt, vinegar and mustard.   The chips are cooked in vegetable oil, which is a plus for me, being veggie and also quite health conscious. I cannot really say anything about the other food, as I have only ever come here for chips, but the fish and chips are a steal at 4.50.   The premises is clean, modern and in a very central location, close to festival theatre, he national museum of Scotland,  the University of Edinburgh and Surgeons' hall.

ihCme8N7gZqwgGoki0IoZA.text: I had the haddock fish and chips and it was about the best I have had while in the UK. Very lightly battered golden brown with moist flaky haddock inside. Served with peas and chips. The view was also nice from the second floor corner table.

HjMoSVub1FiRvYywXOyKqQ.text: I like City Restaurant. It's one of these places that doesn't try to hide in any way the fact that they use frozen, processed food. I don't like all these places around Edinburgh trying to lure the unknowing tourists in with there menu slogans of 'True traditional homemade Scottish food' and what you get has Farmfood written all over it. At City Restaurant you know from the moment you see the very american road side dinner style that I'm gonna get fast food nutrition.   So far there is nothing in my words written, that explains why one would want to dine her. Well simply I just really like  now and then after a long rainy grey day to sit down in a place where one can put yer feet up, whistle a tune, put my elbow right on the table and hand pushing my face to the side, fork in the other and just eat with out any one giving a damn about my manners. So if you seek this look no further.   My rating of three stars? Well first of all any processed food just can't get more then an OK. The only thing that differs a one, two and three is the size of the burger and City Restaurant isn't short on size here. 8.99 for the City burger big enough to hide my face with, plenty of onion rings and chips.  Simply shitlicious!!

6TKi5h6NuAMXj6ah15AijA.text: This is one of those Edinburgh institutions that you've walked past a hundred times without a second glance. I was taken here by my colleague who remembers coming here when he was a kid. I don't think I'm talking out of turn when I suggest that that was a long time ago.  It looks like a sort of upmarket chippy, with loads of comfy booths. Almost like an American diner, an impression reinforced by the friendly table service. And it's a lot bigger than it appears, with additional seating on the first floor.  They do a long list of British greasy spoon standards, but with less of the greasy. I had an omelette and it was deliciously light and fluffy, and a great deal too. Three-egg omelette with choice of filling, served with chips and peas, for 5.95. Washed down with a cold bottle of Caley 80, it was the perfect lunch.  Next time I'm out and about in this part of town and looking for a cheap tasty meal, I won't hesitate to come back here.

XNvDx_xHch7HRvnYfmmr0Q.text: Owen: I really wanted to like you City Restaurant.  CityR: Uh-oh...  Owen: Yeah this is the "let's just be friends" bit.  CityR: B..b....but...what did I do wrong?  O: Well on our first date we had takeaway fish and chips. The batter was more like soggy skin, the chips were pretty "Meh" and you gave me a warm can of coke (fill from the back, take from the front people).  C: Ok, but I was having a bad day. I'd just run over my cat or something.  O: Fair enough. I'm all for second chances. So I took you out for breakfast. You were adequate. As in average, run-of-the-mill, unexceptional. And what's up with your ketchup and brown sauce? Quick tip; DO NOT LET IT IN YOUR MOUTH.  C: I have cute American diner-esque booths!  O: You do, you do. You also have the takeaway ordering bit, the cash register and the front door all smooshed together. Leading to the occasional pileup. It's not very Feng Shui.  C: ...*weep*...  O: And your full breakfast is just shy of 9.  C: We can still be friends though?  O: Honestly, I already have enough friends.  C: Facebook?  O: Sure. You'll add me and we'll do a little wall-post tennis then I'll delete you in 6 months and you won't even notice.  C: Waaaaaaaahhhh!  O: There, there.....there, there....it's all right...

ZqvMg7t6JLIzCV1HlxZh6Q.text: I very nearly scoffed at the City Restaurant, for calling itself a restaurant while having a big chippy counter slap bang in the middle of it. But I quickly realised it was more a diner than anything else, and a jolly good one at that!  Selling slap-up meals of burgers, chips, and beans on toast, it does diner fayre to perfection. The burgers are pretty massive, the chips are nice and soft and it's got a great bunch of greasy spoon options.  It's clean and there's loads of space. It's not the kind of establishment that's open at three in the morning, but although that may come as an inconvenience when you're drunk and in need of food, their opening times are also successful at deterring unsavoury customers at all times of the day. It's great for families and, believe it or not, a wee evening meal for two! For serving up simple but tasty food, it's awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of City Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

zAHTk6ae9pLKh6R7qCrfJA.text: Nice and cozy, great customer service, however food not worth the money at all.

t8SBIJRAAz9PqYThcgyvUA.text: This is one of those places you'd happily eat your dinner at everyday of the year before ending up excessively overweight, but not necessarily unhappy.  The food itself is what I'd call good, honest food.  The vast majority of it is very greasy, but it doesn't mind it and nor will you as you eat it and not just because it's cheap and fills you up.  It's certainly no health shop, but so long as you aren't in here every day it makes a great treat.  If you leave here hungry then quite frankly there's got to be something wrong with you.  The whole place has an unpretentious atmosphere and it's quite happy for you to sit in or take the food with you, most commonly to eat on your way home after a night out.  Order chips in such situations and you'll be pleasantly surprised not only by the price, but also by the quality and volume of the food you'll be given.

photos.caption: Photo of City Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

lNrG-WIGXeJTWIY1uSOBpg.text: Despite appearing like some sort of American style diner (and it does look quite cool), City Restaurant is very British. Whilst small, seemingly nothing-special joints like this in the States might actually serve fantastic bagels or waffles or whatever, in Britain they tend to serve standard greasy chips. I think there is maybe some problem involving lack of  pride or something.  City Restaurant really isn't that bad a place. It's clean enough, friendly enough, it's not exactly expensive.  But I'm put off by the quality of the food. Maybe it's because I'm too concerned about what goes into my body that I can't appreciate a place like this. I also find it hard to find great options as a vegetarian although their baked potatoes aren't half bad.  There is still some charm to be had here, but some added homely family style cooking, or some quirky speciality wouldn't go amiss.

photos.caption: Photo of City Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of City Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

T_dNpkCcvlINGqcuKu48yg.text: After finishing an exam about a month ago, myself and two mates decided to treat ourselves to to dinner in City Restaurant.  We each had a baked potato with tuna mayonnaise which only cost about 3.  The potatoes were enormous and also came with generous side portions of salad  - a good deal for such a low cost.  The service is friendly and efficient and the menu has a pretty good selection.   It also serves traditional chippy food with the usual fish and sausage suppers as well as pizzas which can either be eaten in the restaurant itself or taken away.  It does excellent trade as a result of this and is always quite busy around lunch and dinner time.  Nothing which they serve is overpriced and the standard of the food is generally quite good, definitely worth a visit for a cheap meal when you can't be bothered cooking.

photos.caption: Photo of City Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

lQBb4oSG9ok70C3wa3UH6Q.text: The City Restaurant is nothing fancy and as previous reviewers have mentioned it's a greasy spoon type cafe. It's pleasant enough though, clean, bright and if you get a seat at the window it's the perfect spot for people watching. The last time I was here it was late afternoon and it was rather busy with people getting after work snacks so we were lucky to get a table. I ordered a full cooked breakfast with a generous helping of sausage (square slice and links), fried egg, beans, mushrooms, potato scone, two pieces of buttered toast and a cup of tea - okay, so not the healthiest meal but it was delicious and I polished it off in record breaking time.  I've also sampled their fish and chips and they are also top notch. Overall, if you're looking for a good meal to fill you up but aren't too bothered about counting your calories then this place is perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of City Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

qs1EkCTlC9cDES3KgBlPdw.text: Fish and chips ( cod, Hake, sea bass etc ). Cold beer. Affordable quick lunch in the city. great service ,clean bathrooms. Near surgeons of museum.

photos.caption: Photo of City Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Sea bass.
Photo of City Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Battered cod. Yum yum.

JmwSnz_Rzm01epJ2OUWaMA.text: I ordered a simple hamburger which they over cooked. So tough I had to use a knife to cut it. No trace of salt on the burger and French fries

5r7Fcct2L6G-7bSZ3WxpOA.text: My wife and I visited Edinburgh a few months ago and had a bad experience at City Restaurant. The place wasn't crowded so we sat at a booth that seats about 6. A few minutes after we sat down, a waitress asked us to move so that a larger group could use our table. We obliged and moved. Then we watched as the waitress sat a party of 3 at our table. There were plenty of other tables that could have accommodated 3 people. The manager saw this and came over to apologize, and offered to move us back to our previous table, but we didn't want to move again and cause a scene.   The food tasted ok, but my wife got food poisoning from the fish & chips. She ended up spending our last 2 days in Edinburgh hugging the toilet.

nSg33LLXD6I1haAbDMenFA.text: On the 31st of May I stopped at City Restaurant for lunch. I was willing to try two things on the menu so I decided to get a mince pie and fish cakes. I also ordered a small glass of Irn Bru. Both pie and cakes came with chips so I did not want to get twice the amount and I just asked for one portion. The mince pie arrived and it was not amazing. It was rather rustic and it lacked flavor. It tasted "industrial" and quite plain. The fish cakes were filled with haddock and mozzarella and they were a little weird but good (fish and cheese is not the perfect pairing). The chips were standard and there were plenty of them. The Irn bru glass was good as expected with its distinctive Scottish soft drink flavor that I could describe as a "chewing gum soda". This places seems to be overrated with 4 stars. I give 3 stars since it's nothing out of the ordinary.

photos.caption: Photo of City Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mince pie and fish cakes with haddock and mozzarella plus Irn Bru

edijl2vq3Qf0gOqqxwYpcA.text: The concierge recommended this spot for fish and chips. I would have never stopped here on my own because the decor looks too "fast food-like" but the food was delicious. The portion was great for the price and came with a few delicious sides. The drink menu was surprisingly diverse for what I was expecting from the outside appearance. Definitely recommend for good food, fairly priced, and excellent service

photos.caption: Photo of City Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Panko breaded haddock.

eY64mC0-Nyp2ETR07arctw.text: We ordered City Burger (2 6 oz. Angus patties with melted Monterey Jack, bacon, lettuce and tomato), Margherita pizza, Vegetarian breakfast (potato scone, roasted tomatoes, mushrooms, beans, sliced pita bread, breakfast tea, 2 sliced toast), Italian Salad (mozzarella, prosciutto, salami, sun roasted tomatoes, bell peppers, artichoke hearts, lettuce, Italian dressing, olives, cherry tomatoes).  Wonderful, tasty meal!

photos.caption: Photo of City Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

cgEVFg2hpdr6rvuG0SvHUQ.text: The place really sticks out when walking down the road given it's so bright red. It has a modern vibe but also some traditional Scottish dishes. I had the steak pie and it was pretty good, but could have used a bit more flaky crust on the top. My friend had the cod fish and the waitress says it's caught daily there so couldn't be much fresher than that! Overall a decent experience but would probably skip for a different place next time.

photos.caption: Photo of City Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cod fish and chips
Photo of City Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Steak pie
Photo of City Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Menu!

yPmPbTvbdv9wLlNXXdUu8A.text: Nice little diner-style restaurant. They're open breakfast to late and do take away as well. The staff was very friendly and food was good for the price. Not gourmet, but solid diner food! Would definitely come back here.

photos.caption: Photo of City Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

liiFpc8uJ1NcvmFfDE-EYw.text: I'd always avoided the City Restaurant as it always looked like a sit-in chippy but after attending an event at the Surgeon's Hall across the road we decided to head over and get something quick and easy. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised against my expectations but wouldn't put it up as a fine dining experience.  It is really a good quality chip shop food with the Fish & Chips very good (and nice to have some proper mushy peas to go with them). You can also order a variety of pizza and pasta dishes too which looked acceptable.   Price wise it was quite reasonable at just over a tenner for a main meal and a drink so if you need somewhere fairly fast for OK grub then City Restaurant is adequate but if you are looking for a nice meal carefully prepared then go somewhere else.

photos.caption: Photo of City Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

qxCC43Cl-8SaGVOvOl2erQ.text: It has been a very very long time since I've had fish and chips as I have celiac disease. But!! This place has an Honest to god gluten-free fish and chips!! They taste great and cooked in it own gluten-free fryer!  So many tears of happiness. Thank you! Thank you!!

photos.caption: Photo of City Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. A nice gluten free portion of haddock
Photo of City Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Gluten-free fish and chips options

sJSE4mhMmDKfuBIK2k2qKA.text: We went for the excellent traditional fish and chips. Deliciously fresh side salad takes a little guilt out of the fried stuff. Brightly colored interior, friendly wait staff and very reasonable prices. Good Italian draft lager. And the milk shakes are made with Di Rollo of Musselburgh, a local supplier that puts the rich and creamy in it.

photos.caption: Photo of City Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Delicious haddock fish and chips with side salad. Huge portion, fresh taste.  Goes great with chocolate milk shake.

SSR3ol15shzGHWbfi28mcg.text: I have mixed feelings. Ordered fish and chips. Got a good tasting battered cod and good chips. The mashed pees were average and I could be without their tartan sauce which was actually bad in taste.  The atmosphere is to sterile for my taste but you sit comfortably.  Strange (interesting?) plates. You could not rest your cutlery on them so you have to put them on the table or hold them if you you want to take a pause.  Average prices.

zzUJtw9yiJbbB8Fpph_-cg.text: We were looking for a cheap restaurant that offered American-style food, so City Restaurant seemed like the perfect place to go. I really liked the diner theme, and the restaurant had a very laid-back environment, which was good because we needed to unwind after a long day. A waitress seated my two friends and me upstairs in a large booth. The menu actually has a great range of options. One of my friends got mac & cheese, which I tasted and thought was great, if a little overpriced for what it was. My other friend and I couldn't decide on what entree we wanted, but we knew we were hungry -- so we decided to share a margherita pizza, curry fries, and lentil soup. The pizza wasn't anything particularly special but it satisfied both of us. The "curry" on the curry fries was more like gravy that had curry spices in it, but they still tasted pretty good. I was surprisingly impressed with the lentil soup; it was big enough to share and tasted fresh. So it was a large, cheap, decently satisfying meal. The friend and I who shared food paid only 8 each, which was less than we had spent on breakfast earlier in the day. The service was good overall. The only complaint I had was that they seemed to be rushing us out because we were seated in the first floor instead of the ground floor -- even though the restaurant wasn't supposed to close until 1:00am, the first floor seemed to close at 10:00pm. It wasn't too big of a deal since we were finishing up our meal anyway, but we would have asked to be seated on the ground floor if we knew it were open later.

jEQmM-yA8-_dLUvKzPMUzQ.text: Thank god this place exists. Its devastatingly hard to find a good fish and chip shop near our house, and thank the lord this place is just in walking distance.  Super good quality fish and chips and a broad and varied menu. A tiny bit pricy, but worth it for a nice wee treat after a long day.   Sitting in feels a bit strange, and I'm not sure I would recommend it unless its peeing it down with rain. This is mainly because I feel like I'm slightly wedged in, and its a bit too boxy and plastic. It feels like being in a cut price sci-fi, that serves fried goods as its main plot.

bo2dOlQV35xA60owsQ9xBg.text: Really nice place, Good prices, delicious food and affortable. I tried fish and chips and I can only recommend. Staff is really nice. Go and try

photos.caption: Photo of City Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Really good place, typical foods, Good prices. Fish and chips are really delicious and affortable. I was suprised :)

DLYN520emeGnUaj1mCCJRA.text: The City Restaurant is basically your modern incarnation of the traditional Italian cafes that used to be so popular in our cities. It's clean, diner-style interior is bright and cheery of an evening and it's a great place to get a reasonably priced meal or snack before going to the theatre.  Yes, they do have a chippy bit at the front but the sit-in menu is much more extensive than that. During the day it's perfect for a filled roll right through to a full greasy spoon fry-up breakfast. Their veggie option isn't that great to be honest, but meat-eaters will be in carnivore heaven.  The chippie take-away options are as you would expect, but the portions are good and they'll deep-fry pretty much anything for you. I once saw some schoolgirls ask for a deep-fried curly-wurly (*chocolate bar for those not familiar with local sweets) - I kid you not! They did it too...  Always some cheery banter from the staff, no matter how busy it is, and the upstairs is great if you want a quieter experience.

3f9b8WSuHYyyg1dNg07R9A.text: Open late! We ordered the fish & chips to share (2ppl) and it was enough for both of us. Perfectly crispy fish and yummy chips. Everything cooked to perfection. Love it with the malt vinegar & salt. Super casual environment. Would go back.

u9NES5BAOnni4tMQHQAjlw.text: Friendly staff, and not in that painfully forced way, good food, expected prices. Like other people have said, it's good greasy spoon food, but in quite a clean place. It looks a bit like a hotel, actually. All the traditional breakfasts come with coffee/tea as well.   No need for a long review here, that's really all there is to it

photos.caption: Photo of City Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

IW0dCBLF6pFcefs5TyXFyA.text: Great service, drinks and food.  Our family of 7 had a wonderful meal here after a long day of touring the sites in  Edinburgh.  Every dish we ordered was amazing.  Our server was SO great...lots of suggestions on what to order and lots of attention to our needs.

gsD2klbv-GAJrtDMBL4cEg.text: Staff are friendly and relaxed in this Italian diner-style restaurant. It's a sort of fast food Italian plus fish and chips. There is a limited range of pasta and pizza dishes so I tried the tomato penne, usually a fairly standard fare. It actually tasted really good, with fresh ingredients, so hats off to the chef. It's as though they've got a really good cook who's limited by the menu. Price is not expensive but it's high enough that would tend to go elsewhere for more ambience and variety.

photos.caption: Photo of City Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
